meanings.definition: The act of renovating or improving something, especially a building or room.
meanings.sent1: The renovation of the old house took months to complete.
meanings.sent2: The school underwent a renovation to add more classrooms.
meanings.sent3: The renovation of the kitchen turned it into a chef's paradise.
meanings.sent4: Her wardrobe needed a renovation to bring it up to date.
meanings.sent5: The renovation of the park transformed it into a beautiful green space.

meanings.definition: The process of making something new or bringing it back to a good condition.
meanings.sent1: A renovation of the playground equipment made it safe for the children to play.
meanings.sent2: The renovation of the historic building preserved its original charm.
meanings.sent3: The renovation of the car made it look brand new.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity sparked a renovation of the traditional recipe.
meanings.sent5: The renovation of the garden brought life back to the neglected plants.

meanings.definition: The action of restoring something to a better state.
meanings.sent1: The renovation of the antique clock made it tick perfectly again.
meanings.sent2: The renovation of the painting revealed its true beauty.
meanings.sent3: The renovation of the old bookshelf turned it into a work of art.
meanings.sent4: His kindness was like a renovation for her broken heart.
meanings.sent5: The renovation of the worn-out shoes made them comfortable to wear again.
